title: Pork Chops with Apple Marinade
ingredients: 6 pork chops, ½ pound each, shoulder cut
2 tablespoons minced fresh savory; or, 2 teaspoons dried
instructions: In a shallow ceramic or glass dish, just large enough to hold the pork chops in one layer, combine the apple juice, the oil, the lemon juice, the onions, the savory, and the salt.  Add the pork chops, turning them to coat them with the marinade, and let them marinate, covered and chilled, at least 6 hours or over night.  Turn them occasionally.

Drain the pork chops, reserving the marinade, and grill them over charcoal, basting them with the reserved marinade, for 20 minutes on each side, or until they are firm to the touch and no longer pink within.
Arrange the pork chops on a heated platter and place 1 teaspoon of apple jelly on the top of each pork chop.  Let the heat of the pork chop melt the apple jelly and serve.
source: Unknown, probably for a special in the Food Section of the Express News.
